properties.areaDesc: Outer waters from Santa Cruz Island to San Clemente Island to 60 NM offshore including San Nicolas and Santa Barbara Islands; East Santa Barbara Channel from Pt. Conception to Pt. Mugu CA including Santa Cruz Island; Waters from Pt. Sal to Santa Cruz Island CA and westward 60 nm including San Miguel and Santa Rosa Islands; Point Piedras Blancas to Point Sal westward out to 10 NM; Inner waters from Point Mugu to San Mateo Pt. CA including Santa Catalina and Anacapa Islands; Point Piedras Blancas to Point Sal from 10 to 60 NM
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued January 31 at 4:28AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
A low pressure system will pass through northeast California on
Sunday, with strong northwest winds forming over the southern half
of California Sunday afternoon through Monday. Gale force winds
between 35 and 45 knots are likely over all waters, with a chance
of storm force winds over 50 knots for the outer waters from the
Central Coast to San Nicolas Island. These winds will generate
very steep seas everywhere, from 8 to 12 feet at 8 seconds from
Santa Barbara to Los Angeles, to 18 to 22 feet at 12 seconds from
the Central Coast to San Nicolas Island.

This is a rare and dangerous event, with conditions like this
occurring once every 5 to 10 years. Mariners should seriously
consider staying in safe harbor Sunday and Monday. Continue to
monitor the latest forecasts as we get closer to this event.

NWSheadline: WIDESPREAD STRONG WINDS AND DANGEROUS SEA CONDITIONS LIKELY SUNDAY AND MONDAY
